column2: ARIZONA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. This road sign means:
2. When approaching a school crossing the speed limit  is:
3. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column6: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.

column2: 4. The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
column4: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.
column6: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.
column8: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.

column2: 5. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.
column6: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
column8: speed up and proceed through the intersection.

column2: 6. Never make a U-turn from:
column6: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 7. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 8. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column6: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column8: look both ways and be ready to stop.

column2: 9. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column4: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 10. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
11. This road sign means:
12. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

column2: 13. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
14. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
16. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: the first rain after a dry spell.
column6: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
column8: after it has been raining for an hour or more.

column2: 17. What does this road sign indicate?
column6: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 18. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
19. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 20. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
21. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
22. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column8: help you to be a better driver.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
24. Roads are most slippery:
column4: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 25. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 26. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column6: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 27. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
column6: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.
column8: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.

column2: 28. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
29. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.

column2: 30. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.
column6: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
column8: slow down and adjust their driving manner.
